p: The release of interleukin-1 β (IL-1 β), which is a cytokine, plays a key role in the initiation of the gout disease. Actually, the crystals lead to the activation of monocyte and then releasing caspase-1, which induces the IL-1 β secretion [ 51]. The blocking of this cytokine represents an effective treatment of acute and chronic gout. Among IL-1 β inhibitors that are used, there are anakinra, canakinumab, rilonacept, and pralnacasan [ 52– 55].
